moves.1. d4: D4, I encounter many problems against this but also have lots of fun
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 g6: I like this style of opening, although I may when given time adopt something different in the future
moves.3. Nc3 Bg7 4. e4 d6: Nothing new here all pretty standard
moves.5. h3: I think this is a little early and white would have been better placed by developing a piece
moves.5... O-O: I put the king away and now must think how I am going to get into Whites area
moves.6. f4: White has a lot of centre control but has some gaps at the back
moves.6... Nh5 7. Nf3 Ng3 8. Rh2 Nxf1 9. Kxf1: After the exchange all is equal but white is ahead on development
moves.9... Nc6 10. d5: Not sure about that last move as it opens the diagonal up for my bishop
moves.10... Na5 11. Qd3 b6: The knight needs an escape square
moves.12. b4 Nb7 13. Be3 a5: Black is attempting to break out and if  succesful Whites King looks a little exposed
moves.14. b5: White is having non of it, the knight is now pinned
moves.14... e6 15. g4: White is not shy about throwing pawns forward, but as I said earlier there is lots of space at the back if only I can get my pieces into it. Taking the d pawn will open the position a little
I am not against a file opening up as I think i stand a little better than White now
moves.20... h6 21. h4 h5 22. gxh5 Qf6 23. hxg6: Ouch I am very pleased with this move
moves.25. Rxg6+ Qxg6 26. Nxb5: I know have a file to work with and can put White under some pressure
moves.26... Qg4: The E pawn is going to fall
moves.27. Qc3+ Kg8 28. Nxc7 Nxe4 29. Qa3: The end is coming for White, Blacks's attack is unstoppable
moves.29... Ng3+ 30. Kg1 Re2 31. Ne1 Qh3: I had to be really patient in this game and capitalized on Whites over aggression
